components.ckwuq8zek:
This component receives a data from the [OpenSync](https://docs.totaljs.com/opensync/) app. Data example: ```js { id: String, // Internal ID type: String, // Parsed content-type (can be empty with the "GET" method) channel: String, // Channel ip: String, // Host IP address method: String, // HTTP method (upper-case) headers: Object, // Key:value query: Object, // Key:value body: Object, // JSON/key:value/String ua: String, // Parsed user-agent files: [Object Array] // Uploaded files { filename: String, extension: String, type: String, size: Number, url: String, width: Number, height: Number } } ```
URL address + token
Enter URL address + token to the OpenSync server. This component will connect to the OpenSync via WebSocket.
NAME

components.ckwuq9pk8:
The component is extraordinary because it must be executed directly from the source code via the `flowstream.exec()` method. The component triggers received data into the Flow. ```js var opt = {}; opt.id = 'ID_OF_EXEC_INSTANCE'; opt.data = { custom: 'data' }; opt.callback = function(err, msg) { // msg.uid; // msg.ref; // msg.repo {Object} // msg.data {Object} // msg.cloned {Number} how many times was the message cloned? // msg.duration {Number} in milliseconds }; // optional: // opt.vars = {}; --> custom variables // opt.repo = {}; --> custom repository data and this data will be returned in the callback // opt.uid; --> for storing some unique ID // opt.ref; --> for storing some reference ID flowinstance.exec(opt); ```
NAME
components.ckwuq9rvk:
This component registers an HTTP Route and sends request data next. __Output data__: ```js { "route": String, "params": Object, "query": Object, "body": Object, "files": Array, "headers": Object, "url": String, "ip": String, "cookies": Object } ```
Method
Relative URL address
Timeout
Request limit
Response
NAME
components.ckwuq9u6w:
Interval
In milliseconds
Type
Random data
Data
 The component triggers data into the Flow in the specified interval.
NAME
Interval: ms
components.ckwuqa354:
The component creates a HTTP request. Incoming data will be serialized as the payload. __Response__: ```json { status: Number, headers: { key: value }, cookies: { key: value }, host: String, body: String/Object/Buffer } ```
NAME
Method
URL address
URL address supports dynamic variables in the form {key}
Timeout

Timeout in milliseconds
Max. size

Response max. size in bytes
Serialization
Headers
Headers support dynamic variables in the form {key}
Cookies
Cookies support dynamic variables in the form {key}
Parse Response to Object
Enable DNS cache
Allow insecure connection
Add XHR header
Forward response body only

components.ckwuqbayw:
This component monitors a memory consumption (in MB) in the Linux systems. It uses `free` command. __Data Example__: ```js { free: 0, total: 0, used: 0 } ```
Interval
In seconds
NAME
components.ckwuqbco0:
This component monitors open connections to the specific port in the Linux systems for the specific process. It uses `netstat` command. __Data Example__: ```js { port: 80, connections: 54 } ```
Port number
Interval
In seconds
NAME
components.ckwuqbgws:
This component monitors CPU (in %) and Memory consumption (in MB) in the Linux systems for the specific process. It uses `ps` command. __Data Example__: ```js { grep: 'nginx', cpu: 0.5, memory: 45, files: 343, uptime: '1 day' } ```
Interval
In seconds
App name
NAME
components.ckwuqbj84:
This component monitors CPU `% percentage` consumption in the Linux systems. It uses `mpstat` command with 10 seconds interval. __Data Example__: ```js { cpu: 30, // percentage cores: [4, 60, 0], // percentage count: 3 // count of cores } ```
NAME
components.ckwuqbljg:
This component monitors last line in some text file with the help of `tail` command in the Linux systems. __Data Example__: ```js { value: 'Some meessage' date: Date } ```
Path
NAME -
components.ckwuqboe8:
This component monitors HDD consumption (in MB) in the Linux systems. It uses `df` command. __Data Example__: ```js { free: 0, total: 0, used: 0 } ```
Interval
In seconds
Path
NAME

components.ckxfxgv70:

Absolute path to the file. The path starts with the ~ char will use a filename in the project's root directory.
Serializer
Rewrite content
Divider

components.ckxfxgza8:
Path
Absolute path to the file. The path starts with the ~ char will watch filename in the project's root directory.
Interval
Parser
 The component watches the existence of the file, then reads the content and sends it next. The file will be removed automatically after reading.

config.template:
*** Service Foot ***
CAN 2022
Le match : @{model.home_name} vs @{model.away_name}
Commence dans 5 minutes.

LIVE SCORE API
----CAN 2022------
Données indisponibles pour l'instant.
Revenir à @{model.time_left}, le temps que notre équipe de donnée s'installe
https://live-score-api.com/

config.code: $.send('output', data);

config.template:
*** Service Foot ***
CAN 2022
Le match : @{model.home_name} vs @{model.away_name} a commence.
Score : @{model.score}

*** Service Foot ***
CAN 2022 
Burkina Faso vs Gabon 
MATCH TERMINE 
Victoire des Etalons apres des tirs au buts.
Felicitation aux Etalons

components.cl09vtgcu:
## Outputs - response from nosql engine ## Settings - collection: (optional) if not set, incomming data object must have a 'collection' property set - method: (optional) if not set, incomming data object must have a 'method' property set ## Input ```javascript { collection: 'users', // optional, will override settings value method: 'find', // optional, will override settings value // for Insert, Update data: { ... }, // for Query, Read, Update, Remove filter: [ ['where', 'sensor', 'temp'], // builder.where('sensor', 'temp'); ['limit', 2] // builder.limit(2); ], upsert: true // only for update, if set then document will be inserted if it doesn't exist addid: true // only for insert and update, if set then id prop will be automaticaly generated (for update only when upsert is also set) } ``` ## Insert - inserts recieved data - expects data to be an Object - returns error, success, id ## Read - returns first document found - requires `filter` - returns error, response ## Update - updates document(s) - expects data to be an Object with all the props to be updated - requires `filter` - returns error, response - if response is 0 then update failed ## Remove - removes document - requires `filter` - returns error, response - if response is 0 then remove failed ## Query - returns all documents found - requires `filter` - returns error, response
DB collection(table) name
Method
Add unique ID to `id` property of data before insert
Insert document if it doesn't exist
Add unique ID to `id` property of data before insert (only if it doesn't exist)
NAME

components.c106716f24:
This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is. To send data to the default output use `send(somedata);` To send data to specific output when number of outputs > 1 use `$.send('outputX', somedata)` where `X` is output index, see example bellow: - first output--> `send(somedata)` or `$.send('output', somedata)` - second output --> `$.send('output2', somedata)` - ... - 5th output --> `$.send('output5', somedata)` - etc.

components.c3npm1f62e:
The component is extraordinary because it must be executed directly from the source code via the `flowstream.exec()` method. The component triggers received data into the Flow. ```js var opt = {}; opt.id = 'ID_OF_EXEC_INSTANCE'; opt.data = { custom: 'data' }; opt.callback = function(err, msg) { // msg.uid; // msg.ref; // msg.repo {Object} // msg.data {Object} // msg.cloned {Number} how many times was the message cloned? // msg.duration {Number} in milliseconds }; // optional: // opt.vars = {}; --> custom variables // opt.repo = {}; --> custom repository data and this data will be returned in the callback // opt.uid; --> for storing some unique ID // opt.ref; --> for storing some reference ID flowinstance.exec(opt); ```
NAME

components.c752y3c0f7:
The component splits a message with an array of objects on the input into separate messages with individual objects on the output. __Input example__: ```js [ { "email": "michal@totaljs.com", "date": 20220202, "meno": "Michal Klacan" }, { "email": "martin@totaljs.com", "date": 20220204, "meno": "Martin Smola" }, { "email": "peter@totaljs.com", "datum": 20220210, "meno": "Peter Sirka" } ] ``` __Output example__: ```js { "email": "michal@totaljs.com", "date": 20220202, "meno": "Michal Klacan" } ``` ```js { "email": "martin@totaljs.com", "date": 20220204, "meno": "Martin Smola" } ``` ```js { "email": "peter@totaljs.com", "datum": 20220210, "meno": "Peter Sirka" } ```
NAME

components.cd65qc0e42:
This component registers an HTTP Route and sends request data next. It stores `controller` instance in the `message.refs.controller` property. You must respond to the REST response component. < __IMPORTANT__:
The component works only with a defined Proxy endpoint in the Flow settings. < __URL__:
The URL must be relative to the defined Proxy endpoint. So if the endpoint is `/users/` and the desired address is `http://example.com/users/find` then the value must be `/find` __Output data__: ```js { "route": String, "params": Object, "query": Object, "body": Object, "files": Array, "headers": Object, "url": String, "ip": String } ```
No proxy endpoint defined.
This component will not work until then. Please go to main screen, open settings of this FlowStream instance and set the Endpoint.
Method
Relative URL address
Relative path to:
Timeout
Request limit
Send to output
NAME

NAME
components.cifpi82307:
This component implements the [Total.js API Router](https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/cc674001rr51c/#total-js-routing) that allows you to provide only one endpoint (route) by adding multiple endpoints divided by keys. The component expects REST Route message or data in the form: ```js { "schema": "schema_name/{param_1}/{param_2}?query=arguments", "data": {} // optional, request payload } ``` < __Good to know:__
Output data will be the same `data`, but extendend by adding new properties declared below. __Extended output data:__ - `id {String}` first value from dynamic value - `params {Object}` dynamic values - `query {Object}` query arguments - `user {Object}` optional, inherited from the controller - `session {Object}` optional, inherited from the controller - `ip {String}` optional, inherited from the controller If the controller is stored in the `message.refs.controller` property, then its properties like `controller.id`, `controller.params` and `controller.query` will be extendend by values from parsed schema.
Name
Load data from the specific property/field
Optional. The data for the model will be loaded from the specific property/field.
Color
Icon
Rewrite value only (otherwise, it will replace entire message data)
Every name of identifier must be unique per Flow. You can use dynamic arguments in the form {argument_name}
Use names in lower-case. We recommend to keep e.g. users_read/{id} or products_read/{id}
